fillUps.question: Name the place of pilgrimage where this battle took place.
Perfect theistic science: The Bhagavad Gita is the perfect theistic science because it is directly spoken by the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Lord Çré Kåñëa.
Gita-Mahatmya: One should read Bhagavad-gétä very scrutinizingly with the help of a person who is a devotee of Çré Kåñëa and try to understand it without __________________ interpretations.

Dhåtaräñöra’s fear: Dhåtaräñöra became very fearful about the __________ of the holy place on the outcome of the ________, because he knew very well that the holy place would influence the __________ favourably.Dhåtaräñöra did not want a _________ between his sons and the Pandavas.
Saïjaya’s vision: Saïjaya was a student of ______, and therefore, by the mercy of ______, Saïjaya was able to _________ the Battlefield of Kurukñetra even while he was in the room of Dhåtaräñöra.

Example of paddy field: As in the paddy field the unnecessary plants are taken out, so it is expected from the very beginning of these topics that in the religious field of _________ where the father of religion, __________, was present, the unwanted plants like Duryodhana and others would be wiped out and the thoroughly religious persons, headed by _________, would be established by the _______.

Duryodhana’s diplomacy: Duryodhana, after seeing the military force of the _________, at once went to the commander-in-chief, __________, to inform him of the real position, because Duryodhana felt fear on seeing the military arrangement of the __________.To cover up his fear in a _________ way, Duryodhana went to ___________
A solid phalanx of 21,870 chariots, 21,870 _________, 65,610 _________ and 109,350 infantry is called an ________.

mcq.question: As described in the text book, the following warriors are fighting on the side of the Pandavas or Kauravas. Jayadratha

As described in the text book, the following warriors are fighting on the side of the Pandavas or Kauravas. Bhurisravä
As described in the text book, the following warriors are fighting on the side of the Pandavas or Kauravas. Käsiräja
As described in the text book, the following warriors are fighting on the side of the Pandavas or Kauravas. Bhishma
As described in the text book, the following warriors are fighting on the side of the Pandavas or Kauravas. Virata
